p: Participants from farms with one or more dams had higher odds of seropositivity; this may indicate vector-borne exposure of livestock or humans directly because standing water provides breeding sites for mosquitoes previously implicated in RVFV transmission in South Africa ( Culex theileri, Aedes mcintoshi, and Aedes juppi) and which readily bite people, thus suggesting that mosquito-borne human RVFV infection is possible in South Africa [ 16].
